info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 15 at 4:23PM EDT until August 15 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL CABARRUS COUNTY... At 422 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southeast of Downtown Concord, or 4 miles southwest of Mt Pleasant, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Mt Pleasant and Downtown Concord. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
